info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 6:10PM EDT until June 30 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...The following county, in central Ohio, Hocking.
* WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 610 PM EDT, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Logan, Nelsonville, Hocking Hills State Park, Starr, Laurelville, Murray City, Ilesboro, Lake Logan State Park, Union Furnace, Haydenville, Gibisonville, South Bloomingville and Carbon Hill.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING
